segments.en: Linked Discourses 2
3. Various Sectarians
23. With Serī

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho serī devaputto bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Standing to one side, the god Serī addressed the Buddha in verse:
“Both gods and humans
enjoy their food.
So what’s the name of the spirit
who doesn’t like food?”
“Those who give with faith
and a clear and confident heart,
partake of food
in this world and the next.
So you should dispel stinginess,
overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
The good deeds of sentient beings
support them in the next world.”
“It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing,
how well said this was by Master Gotama. He repeated the Buddha’s verses, and said:

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbāhaṃ, bhante, sirī nāma rājā ahosiṃ dāyako dānapati dānassa vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: “Once upon a time, sir, I was a king named Serī, a giver, a donor, who praised giving.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, catūsu dvāresu dānaṃ dīyittha samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavanibbakayācakānaṃ.
segments.en: I gave gifts at the four gates to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, travelers, and beggars.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, itthāgāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the ladies of my harem approached me and said,

segments.pli: ‘devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati; amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati.
segments.en: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, but we don’t.

segments.pli: Sādhu mayampi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā’ti.
segments.en: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
Then it occurred to me,
‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, paṭhamaṃ dvāraṃ itthāgārassa adāsiṃ.
segments.en: And so I gave the first gate to the ladies of my harem.

segments.pli: Tattha itthāgārassa dānaṃ dīyittha; mama dānaṃ paṭikkami.
segments.en: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, khattiyā anuyantā upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then my aristocrat vassals approached me and said,

segments.pli: ‘devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati; itthāgārassa dānaṃ dīyati; amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati.
segments.en: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, but we don’t.

segments.pli: Sādhu mayampi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā’ti.
segments.en: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
Then it occurred to me,
‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, dutiyaṃ dvāraṃ khattiyānaṃ anuyantānaṃ adāsiṃ.
segments.en: And so I gave the second gate to my aristocrat vassals.

segments.pli: Tattha khattiyānaṃ anuyantānaṃ dānaṃ dīyittha, mama dānaṃ paṭikkami.
segments.en: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, balakāyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then my troops approached me and said,

segments.pli: ‘devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati; itthāgārassa dānaṃ dīyati; khattiyānaṃ anuyantānaṃ dānaṃ dīyati; amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati.
segments.en: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, your aristocrat vassals give gifts, but we don’t.

segments.pli: Sādhu mayampi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā’ti.
segments.en: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
Then it occurred to me,
‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, tatiyaṃ dvāraṃ balakāyassa adāsiṃ.
segments.en: And so I gave the third gate to my troops.

segments.pli: Tattha balakāyassa dānaṃ dīyittha, mama dānaṃ paṭikkami.
segments.en: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, brāhmaṇagahapatikā upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then my brahmins and householders approached me and said,

segments.pli: ‘devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati; itthāgārassa dānaṃ dīyati; khattiyānaṃ anuyantānaṃ dānaṃ dīyati; balakāyassa dānaṃ dīyati; amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati.
segments.en: ‘Your Majesty gives gifts, the ladies of your harem give gifts, your aristocrat vassals give gifts, your troops give gifts, but we don’t.

segments.pli: Sādhu mayampi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā’ti.
segments.en: Your Majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
Then it occurred to me,
‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, catutthaṃ dvāraṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ adāsiṃ.
segments.en: And so I gave the fourth gate to my brahmins and householders.

segments.pli: Tattha brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ dānaṃ dīyittha, mama dānaṃ paṭikkami.
segments.en: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, bhante, purisā upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then my men approached me and said,

segments.pli: ‘na kho dāni devassa koci dānaṃ dīyatī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Now Your Majesty is not giving gifts at all!’

segments.pli: Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, te purise etadavocaṃ:
segments.en: When they said this, I said to those men,

segments.pli: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tattheva dānaṃ detha samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavanibbakayācakānan’ti.
segments.en: ‘So then, my men, send half of the revenue from the outer districts to the royal compound. Then give half right there to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, travelers, and beggars.’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ dīgharattaṃ katānaṃ puññānaṃ evaṃ dīgharattaṃ katānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pariyantaṃ nādhigacchāmi—
segments.en: Sir, for a long time I made so much merit and did so many skillful deeds. I never reached any limit so as to say

segments.pli: ettakaṃ puññanti vā ettako puññavipākoti vā ettakaṃ sagge ṭhātabbanti vāti.
segments.en: ‘there’s this much merit’ or ‘there’s this much result of merit’ or ‘for so long I’ll remain in heaven’.
It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing,
how well said this was by Master Gotama:
‘Those who give with faith
and a clear and confident heart,
partake of food
in this world and the next.
So you should dispel stinginess,
overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
The good deeds of sentient beings
support them in the next world.’”

suttaplex.blurb: The deity Serī speaks of how everyone loves food., to which the Buddha responds with verses in praise of giving. Serī speaks of his own generosity in a past life.
